answers.answer: Hello,with well managed diabetes your baby's risk of still birth is extremely low (and similar to someone without diabetes).Please keep working very hard to keep your sugars as close to normal / normal as possible.  This is important even as the delivery approaches.Your doctor should be monitoring you closely at this stage of your pregnancy. This may include doing some extra monitoring by ultrasound and what they call stress tests. If they are concerned regarding the baby they will induce it or deliver it by c-section.You can also monitor your baby's movements.  If you don't feel movements or feel less than usual movements then you can call your doctor to discuss.You are very nearly there.  Just a few days or a few weeks to go.I was diabetic with my last pregnancy, on insulin, and my baby was just fine.  She was born at 38 weeks exactly.I am pregnant again with my second and so far everything is going very well.Please let us know how you go.

Thank you, I have a few high ones from time to time but overall they are good, the stress tests are always good, im just not dilated at all, my doctor is inducing me at 39 weeks, on the 24th of this month.

Sounds like everything is going just as it should.  And your doctor is monitoring you closely.  Many doctors do like to induce their diabetic patients before 40 weeks and 39 weeks sounds pretty safe - that's if you don't go into labor before then on your own.My baby is due on 26th March.  I have doppler study next month (32 weeks) after which they'll decide if I can go to term or if they will be monitoring more closely in case they want to induce.You'll be welcoming your new baby before you know it!Take care
Thank you so much, you really have helped me to stay calm, best wishes to you and I know you cant wait to see your wonderful bundle of joy!

question: Im 37wks and 6days, im A type 2 diabetic, what are my chances of a stillbirth? Im really scared, I take insulin, but I really am scared my baby wont make it, any help please?
title: Diabetes and Stillbirth
